column4: i just got started on ubuntu linux os systems yesterday, can someone tell me how you can install .tar files?
can some one privately talk to be about how i can get use to linux operating systems?
i cant bearly do forums because of work
then go away, its a help place
well, can someone tell me why my adobe wont work
i got the files
created the archive
and it doesnt exist for download
thats the only thing i need
adobe flash
type /topic
not a matter of linux. the topic of *this channel* says: Flash plugin installation is currently broken. This is due to adobe changing the tar file that the package downloads.
yes, if you can wait that would be best
you can convert them, but it's usually a terribly bad idea.
first RPM packages, then "installers"... you're trying to break your system immediately, aren't you?
you're not supposed to talk back to your terminal, you know :)
anyway, yes, it's the exclamation mark

well if you just started yesterday, then be careful about installing things and such. ask here first. as a general rule, you should ONLY install packages from the repositories, and ONLY install stuff that isn't in there if you REALLY know what you're doing
emus?
there are NES and SNES emulators for Ubuntu too.
wtf what?
i made Ubotu send you a private message
i'll make it send you some more about (S)NES emulators
as you can see, there is a low of choice with (S)NES emulators
